intro: Rosa eglanteria f. dimorphophylla, commonly known as the doubleleaf prickly rose, is a unique horticultural form of the prickly rose species. It is characterized by its distinctive foliage, which features two different leaf shapes on the same plant—dichotomous leaves and simple leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of pink and white, often with a subtle fragrance. It is a compact shrub that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a container plant. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is prized by plant enthusiasts and botanic gardens alike.
